boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 08
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:


Jemmish Quartzblood - male gnome sorcerer
Jon-Jon Smallherd - male halfling druid
Kruulik - female orc shaman
Vulella Waveblessing - female sea elf sorceress

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:


Quillis Orfan - female halfling rogue
Y'tregna - male elven bard
Sarka - female gnome warlock
fah-thoon - female dark dwarf sorceress

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 06
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:


A paladin who killed a renegade member of his order is dying
A young noble only has an obsidian shield with a map on it to make his way home
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Adventure Sandbox 02
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventure Sandboxes are a location with a map. Suggested hooks could give characters a reason to visit. You'll also find information about NPCs, geographic features, and situations for your players to discover.

Please note: a Sandbox is NOT a complete adventure! It's a location with details for players to discover and interact with. Sandboxes are game system neutral, meaning you can use almost any system you like to run a game there.

This Sandbox covers Barkdeath, a small city on the Cold Course river. Characters can discover a mysterious female warrior, a shady merchant's association, a noble family member spying on the city, a place to buy exceptional weapons and armor, and much more.

boardgame.name: The Shattered Tower of Grimlov
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many years ago the wizard Grimlov built a tower overlooking the village of Melad Crossings. The wizard was powerful and raiding orcs and goblins were terrified by his presence. Then the tower erupted in a massive explosion. The tower still stands but it is a wreck with gaping holes in it.

All has been quiet at the tower for quite some time. The wizard seemed to have gone missing. Recently, however, there are signs of life at the tower. Creatures have been seen flying and landing near the top of it. Smoke has been seen rising from the top of the tower.

Perhaps Grimlov has returned! Or perhaps someone else has moved in...
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Fulcrum Leader
boardgame.description:
Fulcrum Leader is a solitaire tactical game which depicts the conventional Soviet air campaign against NATO in Europe during the Cold War era. The game covers the crucial decades from 1970s to 1990s as opposing forces faced each other down in a game of nuclear brinkmanship, with featured aircraft including the MiG-29 Fulcrum, MiG-23/27 Flogger, MiG-21 Fishbed, MiG-25 Foxbat, Su-27 Flanker, Su-24 Fencer and Su-17 Fitter.

In Fulcrum Leader, you will need to select the right combination of aircraft in your regiment in order to successfully carry out the different missions which your pilots will execute. You will be faced with the same type of decision-making and risk-taking experienced by Soviet air regimental commanders.

This game adds new aspects of Soviet air operations such as enhanced radio-electric combat, ground controlled intercepts (GCI), and the ever-present political officer watching over your shoulders, the Zampolit. You will need to manage the capability of your pilots, weigh the advantages and disadvantages of your aircraft, use your zampolit to manage your superiors, and avoid the ignoble fate of being sent off to a re-education facility in Kamchatka.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Identity Theft
boardgame.description:
Identity Theft is not a joke. It’s a game!

As skilled digital hackers, attempt to infiltrate your opponents’ defenses and piece together their Identification Numbers. Use the Black Market to attack, defend, and engage in Risky Business. Use your hacking skills at the opportune moments and be careful who you trust. The first hacker to steal all other’s identities is the victor, so do whatever it takes to keep your own identity safe!

Don’t forget to be vigilant! An Undercover Cop or White Hat Hacker can disrupt your schemes at any moment. If you can secure control of the elusive and adorable Botnet your chances for success skyrocket. So what are you waiting for? Get lost in the black market. Release your inner hacker. Show off your best evil grin. Who will you hack first?

Identity Theft - it’s Risky Business!

Each player starts the game with a randomized identity code. Players then play cards to steal information about the code or defend from the attackes. The first player to guess an opponent's identity code wins.

boardgame.name: Demons & Wizards
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Demons & Wizards è un Gioco di Ruolo Doom Fantasy di Narrazione e Avventura che unisce gli elementi dell’Old School con l’ambientazione di un mondo che si affaccia verso un’era tetra e pericolosa.

English translation:
Demons & Wizards is a Doom Fantasy Storytelling and Adventure RPG combining elements of the Old School with the setting of a world facing a dark and dangerous era.

boardgame.name: Specter Ops: Arctic Archives
boardgame.description:
Fans of Specter Ops can now infiltrate a new Raxxon location with this super-sized Arctic Archives map. The other side of the game board is the corrected map from Specter Ops: Broken Covenant - Abandoned Headquarters.

There are 8 terminals on the Arctic Archives side of the board. At the start of an agent or hunter player’s turn, if they are adjacent to a terminal, they may place up to
3 barriers on the board and then proceed with their turn.

Arctic Archives also features 6 supply caches.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Oneironauts
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Oneironauts dive center! This is where your journey through the Dream Ocean will begin!

In Oneironauts all players play as one team. The game lasts a certain number of rounds. At the start of each round take the top card with the word and place it face up. Then players choose from their dream cards the one that matches the word on the card the best. After that a random card is added from the deck and these cards are shuffled all together. Finally all the players simultaneously try to guess the card that was accidentally added. For each correct answer, the team gets one sheep. Players win if they collect 15 or more sheep before they run out of the elixir. Otherwise they lose.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pickit: Dragons
boardgame.description:
Pickit is a card game family with very simple rules. Game start for new players is extremely quick and by playing they continue to explore more.
Dragons is the first game in the series. In Pickit Dragons you collect the cards in order to build complete Dragons in your play area which will then provide you with game advantage for the following rounds.
What makes pickit set collection special is that each dragon has different number of cards
Green dragon - 1 card, Red dragon - 2 cards, Yellow dragon - 3 cards, Blue dragon - 4 cards and Purple dragon - 5 cards.
Based on the size of the dragon you gain points and if dragon doesn't contain any jokers you get also the extra power which you can use from next round on.

Game end is triggered when certain number of points is reached by one of the players.

For more challenging game play you can also use mission cards which you can play as private or common objectives.

Art is very appealing and as there are more designs for each colour of the dragon in each game your dragons will look little differently!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magus
The Magus
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Giocando a Magus, userai dadi e penna per scrivere una vicenda unica sulla ricerca della perfezione nelle arti arcane e sull’infinita solitudine del potere.

English translation:
Playing Magus, you will use dice and a pen to write a unique story about the pursuit of perfection in the arcane arts and the infinite solitude of power.

boardgame.name: Shadow of the Lodge
boardgame.description:
User summary:
D&D 5ed quickstart rules and scenarios for The Silence of Hollowind setting

boardgame.name: Pagoda Jadeitowej Mgły
boardgame.description: A dungeon for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: 1:0 für mich
boardgame.description:
In this simple soccer game, you just move a ball by rolling the dice. The point on which the ball lies indicates which player/team is allowed to roll the dice. The dice indicates one of the 6 ways the ball is moved to the next point. If the ball gets into a scoring position, there is a 1:6 chance of scoring a goal. The game is won by the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pixel Clash
boardgame.description:
In Pixel Clash, 1-6 people can work alone or fight as a team to take down a deadly Dragon and its minions.

The theme of the game is Colourful, Fantasy and Pixel Art.

During setup, each person selects a Player card (e.g. Wizard) selects a Dragon to face-off against (e.g. Blue Dragon) and then the Dragon Action deck is setup (a collection of 14 random Dragon Action cards, and the Game Over card at the bottom).

Each round, Players draw and play 1 Player Action card. Players then draw a single Dragon Action card for the Dragon (off the top of its deck). All cards are resolved in order of the priority number on the cards (highest first).

If all Players die or the Game Over card is drawn - all players lose. If the Dragon's HP drops to 0 - all Players win.

Also, some cards can cause "Minions" to be drawn. Minions stay active until defeated, and can become a nuisance if left to get out of hand (multiple minions can be active at once).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Deutschland Tour
boardgame.description:
On a round trip through Germany, the players start with their game piece in Berlin. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and receives a question from the question booklet, depending on where he is. If the player gives the correct answer, he may advance the number of dice rolled, otherwise he must stop. The player who reaches Berlin first wins the game. There are two different question booklets, one for children and another for teenagers and adults.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Morning Star Observatory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A rugged coastline facing an endless Eastern Sea and the domain of countless seabirds. The crumbled remnants of a still impressive seastack. Carved by the elements and hewn by an order of stargazers, the site houses a vast library and a grand cavern that stares out across an expansive ocean and the far eastern horizon. Devout scholars compiled charts, notes, journals, and diagrams recording nautical and celestial events using devices beyond modern comprehension. These records, along with numerous scrolls, tomes, and treasures lay here still.

The Morning Star Observatory is a series of 7 interconnected isometric-style maps that form one large DELVE depicting a subterranean trek through an abandoned dungeon complex.

Each map is presented separately as a high resolution, full color 8.5x11 page. Ideal for printing and VTT play.

A combined map depicting the entire delve is included, along with a 17x66 poster-style layout. There’s also a bonus area map at the end showing the coastline between the Observatory and the village of Forgotten Point should the GM require a place for adventurers to start.

boardgame.name: Dice Throne: Season Two – GeekUp Bit Set
boardgame.description:
The pieces are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4-color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

This set includes upgraded versions of 86 of the status tokens for the eight heroes, all 20mm circles (3mm deep) for the standard tokens:


Gunslinger (5x Evasive, 4x Reload, 3x Knockdown, 3x Bounty)
Samurai (5x Honor, x6 Shame, x4 Back Strike)
Tactician (x7 Tactical Advantage, x4 Constrict, x4 Targeted, x3 Protect)
Huntress (x2 Nyra's Bond, x5 Bleed)
Cursed Pirate (x6 Cursed Doubloon [32mm size], x4 Powder Keg, x4 Wither, x3 Parley)
Artificer (x8 Synth, x6 Nanite)
Seraph (x5 Flight, x3 Blinding Light, x4 Cleanse, x2 Holy Presence [custom size], x2 Blessing of Divinity [custom size])
Vampire Lord (x5 Bleed, x5 Blood Power, x3 Mesmerize)


Note --> This set does NOT include the Artificer's Bot tokens
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Dice Throne: Season Two – Battle Chest Champion Edition
Dice Throne: Season Two – Battle Chest
Dice Throne: Season Two – Cursed Pirate v. Artificer
Dice Throne: Season Two – Gunslinger v. Samurai
Dice Throne: Season Two – Seraph v. Vampire Lord
Dice Throne: Season Two – Tactician v. Huntress

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #10 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon (https://www.patreon.com/LegendaryLoot) and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the holy liberator, crypt warden's plate, drowning rat charm, and crown of iron sorcery!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like awakened from death, sublime detachment, skeleton crew, and hail of needles!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new penumbra sorcerous origin, battle domain, and college of astrology!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the benevolent mix couatl, the sin-eating jarjacha, and the dreadful carreta nagua, the carriage of the dead!

boardgame.name: The Blessed Doom That Walks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blessed Doom That Walks' is a system-agnostic book containing seven demigods for use with RPGs. Check out the first six pages in the preview.

Contents:

The God King Cuauhtl
The Ice Lich
The Machine Emeritus
The Martyr of War
The Messiah of Thieves
Our Lady of Faces
The Weaver of Dreams


Each demigod from The Blessed Doom That Walks series comes with 1-2 illustrations, a background text, and four D6 tables, that can be used as handouts, plot hooks, or inspiration for your own adventure.

Bear in mind that the provided material will only give you the most rudimentary outline for your own adventures. If you are looking for ideas and a foundation for your own DIY adventure, this is for you.

The D6 tables are as follows:

The adventurers’ goal (suggestions for how to include the player characters)
The demigod’s goal (how it will affect the world/the player characters)
The demigod’s strength (its most powerful natural ability out of many)
The demigod’s weakness (how it is defeated/incapacitated)
The demigods are suggested to be used as antagonists, powerful NPCs or allies, or even as unique patrons or minor deities for the players. They can also be used as a force of nature - an external threat that in essence is neutral and uncaring, reserving the role of the players’ antagonist for someone or something else.

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Oceania Expansion – GeekUp Bit Set
boardgame.description:
The pieces are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4 color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

One set of GeekUp tokens for Wingspan includes 69 Nectar tiles, all 20mm pearlescent circles that are 4mm deep.

boardgame.name: Lord of the Spire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Breach the palace. Purge corruption. Confront the Plague Lord’s servant.

The corruption runs deep in Tora Armis. The Astra Militarum have pried the gates open and reclaimed the outer zones of the spire, but Lord Van Staten’s palace pumps out poisonous heresy like a bloated heart pumps diseased blood. A team in service to Inquisitor Tytrona Dikaisune must lead an elite military strike team into the depths of a palace infected with Nurgle’s rot, confront the daemon responsible, and stop the sickness from spreading.

The third of four battlefield adventures set during the battle for Tora Armis, Lord of the Spire is a Tier-3 scenario for a group of elite Agents seconded to assist the Inquisition. The next part, Affliction Ascendant, will feature a Tier-4 squad of Space Marines on the same battlefield.

boardgame.name: Targi: The Expansion – GeekUp Bit Set
boardgame.description:
The metal action tokens are 3D replicas of the original art from the game, crafted to be the larger and more substantial then their cardboard counterparts.

The goods tokens are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4 color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

One set of GeekUp tokens for Targi Expansion includes the following 36 pieces:


2 date tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
2 salt tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
2 pepper tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
10, 1-value water tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
3, 3-value water tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
2, 5-value water tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
6 metal action tokens (20mm triangles)
4, 3-point metal VP markers (34mm tall)
4, 5-point metal VP markers (34mm tall)
1 metal gold coin (30mm diameter)

boardgame.name: Soaring Lions: No Mercy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you ready to raise the stakes and take your pro-wrestling games to a whole new level? Soaring Lions: No Mercy is an expansion to the award-nominated Soaring Lions roleplaying game, providing you with new rules, resources and game options.

Soaring Lions: No Mercy includes:

Match Stipulations that raise the stakes for Regular and Special Matches alike.
Rules to allow new characters to enter the Big Show as Rookies, Professionals or Experts.
A new Big Series Finale option; the Elimination Series.
Pre-generated League Commissioners, to put their own personal stamp on proceedings.
Pre-generated Sidekicks, to back your character in the ring.
Pre-generated Supporters, to cause mayhem ringside.


Random match location tables.

A new streamlined character sheet and other game materials to support seamless facilitation.

boardgame.name: Hemron's Barrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a clue garnered from a little tomb robbing, you have discovered the location of a lost barrow said to be flush with treasure and magical items. As your careers take off, you find this opportunity too good to pass up!

Although set in the Xobraesal Campaign for six players of second level. this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Guardians
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop V
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop Vol. V
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Aedrenar! A New Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy World full of adventure, designed for masked vigilantes and treasure hunters alike!

Need some new equipment and items for your would-be vigilante? This book introduces a mix of new weapons and equipment useful for any self-respecting crime-fighter or half-decent detective.

Each volume in this new series details a small bit of backstory behind one of Aedrenar's greatest heroes (or villians), and provides some information about some of the gear they carried with them at different times. The best thing, is these heroes have long since had their time (or are prone to lending gear out to fellow heroes), so it can be used in creating your own!

Heroic Armory is a sourcebook for the Aedrenar Campaign Setting, which details new rules for outfitting powerful heroes. It includes a new 'Iconic Artifact' system, as well as numerous new magical devices that are useful to any character!

boardgame.name: Barbarian Primal Path: Path of Roiling Magma
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The force of a barbarian's rage is often described as volcanic, but barbarians following the Path of Roiling Magma truly channel the immense pressures and volcanic forces of the earth into their rages, scouring their foes with heat and unparalleled tectonic forces.

Expanding upon the mechanics of the 5E Barbarian class, this PDF allows you to create barbarians who harness the volatile might of volcanoes through their rages. The PDF also contains three volcanic-themed feats suitable for these barbarians or any other character.

boardgame.name: El Gran Asado
boardgame.description:
El Gran Asado (The Big Barbecue) is a 2-4 player game where players must bet cards to get resource tokens, and then they must exchange those tokens to get more elaborate resource tokens. They can also play action cards to get money or harm other players. The first player to get a Bread, Steak and Wine token and have more than $ 1,000 wins the game.

Each player starts with 5 cards in hand, $ 250 and a resource board. Put the betting board on the center of the table, along with the Asado card.

Each round is played in two phases:

Card Play Phase
During their turn, each player can trade tokens, sell resources to the bank, and play action cards.

Betting Phase
When all players played their cards, the resource betting phase starts. Each player will bet their resource cards (Wheat, Calf, Vineyard and Producer) in the betting board. After betting their cards and throwing the die, the player will claim the corresponding prizes in tokens, and place them in their resource board.

Before ending their turn, they can trade again tokens for more elaborated resources using the cards in their hands, or sell tokens to the bank to get more money.

Once all players have finished betting, all cards are returned to the deck. The obtained tokens remain in their resource boards. A new round starts and 5 cards are dealed to each player.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Feywild Nights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Cantrips, Drinks, and More For 5th Edition

The evening breeze is heavy with the sweet smell of honeysuckle and fireflies make lazy loops through the night air over the excited patrons waiting outside of the Cantrip Cantina. News that Arleena has created a fresh menu brimming with fey-inspired delights has swept the city and those adventurous of spirit and young at heart are ready to kick off the revelry.

Arleena has more than delivered on her prospective patrons’ expectations, creating extraordinary liquors fit for the enchanted lords of the courts themselves, as well as a few of her specialty spells to capture a bit of their feywild wonder.

This supplement includes:

3 new feytouched cantrips.
3 new lighthearted extraordinary liquors.
A new item that Arleena grants to those who study with her.

boardgame.name: Divine Arcane
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Divine Arcane provides 8 new subclases based on divine patrons, four each for Cleric and Warlock. While these subclasses are specialize for Cities of Myth: Fallen Camelot, they fit very well into any setting. The new subclasses are as follows:

Gallantry Domain. Clerics who exemplify chivalric values and protect the weak.
Destiny Domain. Clerics who ensure that prophecy is fulfilled.
Penance Domain. Corrupted clerics attempting to reform.
Vengance Domain. Clerics who use fear and revenge to condemn the wicked.
Souls of the Round Table. A warlock who harnesses the voices of the missing Knights of the Round Table.
The Ankou. These warlocks wield death like a weapon, instilling fear in their enemies and standing strong against its call.
The Fisher King. These warlocks are experts in negating and healing damage.
The Night Shepherd. Trickery and stealth are the foundations of these warlocks.

boardgame.name: Pumpkin Express
boardgame.description:
Pumpkin Express, part of Roll and Write Revolution, is a train game of developing routes from one pumpkin patch to the next. While doing so, players will be placing stations, which then allow them to help ghostly passengers get on board 1 of 3 train cars. Ghost passengers have particular likes of other ghosts within the car.

Players will have to carefully plan the order they place passengers in the queue as those passengers are placed in the cars in the order that they are placed in the queue. The dice are also used to create the tracks.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sic'Em
boardgame.description:
Sic’Em is a 2-5 player card game with an average play time of 10-15 minutes.

Based on the classic card game “War”, Sic’Em adds depth and flavor by introducing fantastical characters with unique abilities!

Played in 10 rounds, players first set creature cards face down, then simultaneously reveal them to determine a round winner based on the highest numbered card. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins! Characters with unique abilities can be used to shape the outcome of the game.

boardgame.name: The Vandermist Dossier
boardgame.description:
In this box are the remains of a cold case from 1979: all clues collected by teenage amateur sleuth Abigail Vandermist, before she disappeared herself. Solve puzzles to unwind the story and uncover the truth.

The player or players can investigate any document in the game at any moment, until they find something that looks like a puzzle. When they solve it, they'll find a clue for how to approach the next one.

The players have a clear end goal: find out what happened to Abigail Vandermist in August 1979. When they find the answer, they'll enter it into the website and get an online epilogue.

This is a one-off game, but regiftable after play.

listing.notes: Played once but used the refill kit to reset it for the next player (there are still items in the refill kit that can be used for 2 more resets I think).

boardgame.name: 7 Csoda: Építészek
7 Cudów Świata: Architekci
7 Divů světa: Architekti
7 Wonders: Architects
7 Wonders: Arquitetos
7 Θαύματα του κόσμου : Αρχιτέκτονες
7 원더스 건축가들
boardgame.description:
In 7 Wonders: Architects, 2-7 players race to become a leader of the ancient world by completing an architectural wonder that will last through the ages.

Players receive an unconstructed wonder at the beginning of the game and must collect resources to build their society, develop military might to navigate conflicts, oversee resource management, research science improvements, and collect civil victory points as they race to leave their mark on world history.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Light Game of the Year Nominee
2022 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2022 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Winner
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: 7 Wonders: Architects – Egyptian Cat Statue Promo

Title: 7 Wonders Architects NL Publisher: Repos Production Language(s): Dutch
Title: 7 Wonders: Architects (EN) Publisher: Repos Production Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Black Drink
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In a fantasy village, witches exist on the margins of society and are treated very badly.
That is why they become witches in the first place.
In The Black Drink, they must choose what indignities are worth enduring. Past that limit, they must go to desperate extremes to summon agreeable demons, gain their help, and learn the secret rituals necessary to repay them. These rituals are capricious and strange, sometimes terrible and sometimes dangerous, but ignoring them comes at a very high cost.

The Black Drink centers on using and concealing witchcraft and leveraging demonic boons to gain power, respect, peace, justice, or perhaps revenge.

Who knows what a witch wants?

The Black Drink is a tabletop roleplaying game about witches who make pacts with demons while tripping on hallucinogenic brews!

Logistics:
- Participants: 2-6, who all share facilitation duties
- Time: A few hours, probably
- Prep: Minimal
- Requirements: Pencils, paper, a drawstring bag, and nine dice (three each in three colors). Character sheets are provided but are not essential.
- Content Warnings: Persecution, magic, demons, tragedy, injustice

boardgame.name: The Mist
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This single page addon gives you a table of random encounters or occurrences in a world being overtaken by THE MIST, weighed by number of days passed since the misery was triggered.

boardgame.name: Queasy Quarry Quest
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This adventure module is about descending into a disused fungus mine filled with Earth’s avenging agents of digestion and decay. It includes:

- 13 keyed locations (including a mine, a tunneling worm's burrow, a reincarnation lab, and a secret roach city)
- Unique NPCs (bugs and dirt dwellers of all sizes and personalities)
- Unique treasures (shiny, medicinal, and explosive)
- GM aids (faction references, NPC stat blocks, rules for exploring the dark, and item and condition cards)
- And lots more gross stuff

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific – For the Emperor expansion
boardgame.description:
For the Emperor is a Battle-pack expansion for Heroes of the Pacific from the Lock and Load Tactical system. Included are eight brand-new scenarios. It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics. The scenarios span the entire length of the war, starting with the Japanese invasion of Wake Island and the Philippine Islands. From the bloody last days of the Japanese on Guadalcanal to the frustrating static warfare on Bougainville.

We witness some of the last and largest Banzai attacks on Guam and Saipan. The close and dirty work of clearing Japanese cave networks on Peleliu and then things come full circle as the Allies return to liberate the Philippine Islands.

For The Emperor, Battlepack is all about the Imperial Japanese Army, and the US Military forces. Get ready to return to the Pacific with For the Emperor!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific

boardgame.name: Santa Monica: The Long Weekend
boardgame.description: It’s the long weekend in Santa Monica, and people are out at various events around town including concerts, sand castle competitions, restaurant openings, and more. Santa Monica: The Long Weekend comes with double wide event cards that can be added to your town, but when you do other players will join the party and get benefits too! Aside from the 14 double sized event cards, owners will also get 12 drafting cards and a brand new scoring tile. Have fun this weekend, it's going to be a hot one!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: On Mars: Alien Invasion – Heat-Transferred Wooden Alien Action Tokens
boardgame.description: A set of 15 wooden heat-transferred Alien Action tokens to replace the punchboard tokens for the Alien player in Chapter 1 of On Mars: Alien Invasion.

boardgame.name: Zatar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zatar is #3 in a series of short hex- and dungeon-crawls for the PINKHACK system, but are easily adaptable to the OSR system of your choice. Each DOOMCRAWL is inspired by the iconic Special Herbs beat tracks by MF DOOM.

What's in this edition?

A short hexcrawl
1d6 Complications to Keep You Broke
2d6 Rumors, Loot, Goods, Encounters, and Freelancers
1d6 Jobs from four Factions

boardgame.name: Secret Bastard Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Duke Nigenard spent decades tirelessly in the pursuit of forbidden magicks to produce the ‘perfect heir.’ When he at last succeeded, she had him assassinated almost immediately by bricking him up in his secret laboratory. Centuries later, rumours persist that beneath the ruins of Lady Chrysocolla’s summer palace lies the old Duke’s dungeon, haunted by the Lady’s bastard siblings...

boardgame.name: The Price of Fame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

System: Low Fantasy Gaming (Gaslight Setting), but easily adaptable to any d20 ruleset.

Target PCs: 4 to 6 heroes, Level 2

Maps: Yes

Pre-Gens: Included

Run Time: One or two 4-hour sessions

The Price of Fame presents a standalone adventure, the first for the Gaslight setting compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system by Pickpocket Press. It is an urban mystery of supernatural horror, pitching the heroes against an unnatural hunger that seems to grip scores of people each evening. Can they find the source of the hunger, or will they end up as its next meal?

Included in this adventure are 6 pre-generated Level 2 characters customized for the Gaslight setting, included the previously unreleased mesmerist and pugilist classes! All are given interconnected backgrounds and the skills necessary to succeed in the adventure, but of course you can use your own characters and classes as you prefer.

boardgame.name: Spy Car
boardgame.description:
You are a Secret Agent. You have the best gadgets, the best smile, the best lines, the most fashionable wardrobe. And the coolest thing you have is your awesome Spy Car. You have all the goodies at your disposal, Oil Slicks, Machine guns, Rockets, Tire slicers, Armor, Solid Rocket Boosters, ejection seats, MP3 player, GPS, and often a supermodel or famous love interest in the passenger seat. You’ll need all that and more if you wish to out maneuver and out gun all the goons, ninjas, and thugs trying to run you off the road. So make sure your clothes are impeccable, your hair in place, and buckle up for a ride!

In Spy Car, you have one goal. Eliminate enough of the Bad Guy's cars to force out the Boss Car. Kill the Boss Car and you win. If you lose all your Vehicle Damage or Health before then, you lose.

You start the game with 6 gadget cards, which give you special abilities above and beyond what you can normally do with your die rolls. You also place out a grid of enemy vehicles cards according to the diagram on the city you are in.

Each turn, you roll 8 standard dice, and 1-4 specialty dice, which are skewed to certain abilities. The specialty dice can give you certain results you are looking for easier, but there is also a Danger result not found in the regular dice, so you need to weigh that risk into your decision on how many to roll. You will use the die results for their basic abilities, or to power up gadgets or combos, which will help you eliminate the enemy's spy vehicles.

Your goal is to eliminate the Boss Car at the end of the wave. Once 10 vehicles are eliminated, the Boss Car comes out. You win the game if you eliminate the Boss. You lose the game if either your health or vehicle damage is reduced to zero.

boardgame.name: Ninja Galaxy: The Ninja Masters
boardgame.description:
The Ninja Masters expansion to Ninja Galaxy:
- Updates some of the base game rules to inject more strategic decision making.
- Improves the capabilities of the Ninja Pawns from the base game with special abilities.
- Adds one-time-use Ninja Master cards to each faction. These Ninja Masters "transfer" Wisdom, Experience, and Fighting ability into a Ninja Pawn for one action.

The new components include updated wooden Ninja Pawns, the Ninja Master cards, and Marking Cards to track hit-point loses.

listing.notes:

I cannot remember ever having any material problems, but theoretically there is some risk. If the receiver (you) does NOT request (and does NOT pay extra for) insurance (decision is totally up to you) then the receiver (you) agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. I know that this paragraph sounds scary, but my lawyer makes me include this -- again, this is probably a non-issue -- I have never had a package that I shipped go missing and think that I have had two people mention extremely minor blemishes incurred during shipping in the last 600 BGG items that I have shipped. boardgame.name: Pirates Under Fire: Mercernary Ship Promo Tile
boardgame.description:
A promo tile to add to the game.
It follows the same rule as the other mercernary ship tiles.

Power: when you place this tile (after paying 4 gold), you activate the power of the 3 possible ships of your color that surround it (left/right and above).

Publisher's blurb:

The September 3, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The September 10, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Primitive Ocean Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitive straw huts dot this seaside village. A wooden walkway connects the two sides of the village. The surrounding forest is lush and green, while broad leaved plants and shrubbery form the undergrowth.
Further out waits the lapping waves of the ocean, gently caressing the sandy shore.

boardgame.name: Primitive Desert Village Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitive straw huts dot this rocky desert village. At its center waits a blood-splattered arena, fortified with wooden stakes and fenced by a thick timber palisade. It is built into a deep gully with a small stream running through it, so onlookers can watch the combat from cliffs and man-made viewpoints higher up.
The surrounding wasteland is barren and dry, filled with sand and crumbling stone from the rocky outcrops. Alongside the river, beyond the arena, prickly plants—as hostile as this land and known as Prophet’s Roses—grow with red blossoms.

boardgame.name: Primitive Forest Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitive straw huts dot this forest village. At its center is a deep gully with a stream running through it. Wooden walkways cross the chasms, connecting the huts to one another.
The surrounding forest is lush and green, while broad leaved plants and shrubbery form the undergrowth. Alongside the river, out of the arena, strange prickly plants grow with red blossoms.

boardgame.name: Primitive Desert Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitive straw huts dot this rocky desert village. At its center is a deep gully with a small stream running through it. Wooden walkways cross the chasms, connecting the huts to one another.
The surrounding wasteland is barren and dry, filled with sand and crumbling stone from the rocky outcrops. Alongside the river, prickly plants—as hostile as this land and known as Prophet’s Roses—grow with red blossoms.

boardgame.name: Passing the Blowtorch
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You were the apprentice of The Wrench, the one who kept things running around here. Now they’re gone.

They did so much for this station, and now it’s all down to you. It’s not just the maintenance of life support systems either—they were a pillar of the community. Those are some big shoes to fill, and while you’re the best one to fill them that doesn’t mean it’s going to be easy.

Can you make your way through your first few weeks without screwing up? Probably not. But you’re going to try.

boardgame.name: Unreasonable Demands
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are the Source.

People come to you to buy all kinds of luxury, rare and (often) illicit goods that they can’t obtain through the common markets. When your clients need something, you almost always know the right place, pedlar or pilot to visit. Those calls, though, are often less than straightforward…

boardgame.name: Spatial Delivery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are an intergalactic courier with a package to deliver.

All you have for an address is a name and coordinates leading to some kind of space station. But you work for the most reliable delivery company in the galaxy, and you’ll be damned if you’re going to lose your bonus.

boardgame.name: Starflung Missives
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are two people who care for each other deeply, seperated by distance and duty.

One of you has been pulled into the interstellar war, fighting on the front lines, while the other remains on the station.

Your only means of communication are short messages, flung through encrypted relays across the stars.

boardgame.name: Adventure Sandbox 03
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventure Sandboxes are a location with a map. Suggested hooks could give characters a reason to visit. You'll also find information about NPCs, geographic features, and situations for your players to discover.

Please note: a Sandbox is NOT a complete adventure! It's a location with details for players to discover and interact with. Sandboxes are game sytem neutral, meaning you can use almost any system you like to run a game there.

This Sandbox covers Good Pool, a small town on the shore of the western sea. Characters can discover a farmer growing giant pumpkins, a girl who disappeared 50 years ago, the worshiper of an evil god who is planning human sacrifices, and much more.

boardgame.name: Dark Ages: Gold Tokens
boardgame.description: A set of 20 metal coins to replace gold tokens in original game.

boardgame.name: Omori: Welcome to Headspace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have been living here for as long as you can remember. Haven't you?

boardgame.name: Omori
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A boy is sleeping in his room.

What's his name?

You don't remember?

That's fine.

You haven't seen him in almost four years, after all.

It doesn't really matter what his name was.

boardgame.name: Dark Ages: Ressource Cache
boardgame.description:
120 realistic resources made out of metal and plastic to replace tokens from original game. Resource Cache includes:

30 pieces of wood
30 metal bars
30 stones
30 pieces of leather hides

boardgame.name: Dark Ages: Heritage of Charlemagne/Holy Roman Empire – Great Domain Neoprene Mat
boardgame.description:
A set of two large double-sided neoprene mats (21.875" x 32.5")
that cover the Holy Roman Empire board and Heritage of Charlemagne board.

boardgame.name: Postcard Guadalcanal
boardgame.description:
A couple weeks ago my 11 year old daughter beat me in this in a typical last-minute cliff-hanger game.

The game is so unpredictable - all the chances are 50% die rolls or coin tosses - it is ideal for solitaire play too.

8 half-month turns for U.S. or Japan to take and keep Henderson Field, Guadalcanal.
2 battleship, 2 cruiser - a 3rd for U.S. if/when 1 is lost - 2 carrier, and 2 transport pieces each, plus Yamato for Japanese if an IJN battleship piece is lost.
6 ground units each
5 U.S. and 4 Japanese air units.

Codebreaking, night combat, radar, Torpedo Junction, Long Lance torpedoes for Japanese cruisers with Night surprise.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 3 (so far) postcard games off in postcard format ... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components ... the front at both A4 (for the units) and A3 (for the chart) and the back/rules as large as you need them. :-) )

boardgame.name: Wing Leader: Supremacy 1943-1945 – Mounted Map
boardgame.description: Cardboard mounted map (34" x 22") for Wing Leader: Supremacy game.

boardgame.name: Dilemma
boardgame.description:
Each trick consists of four cards, one of each suit. Non-dealer leads to the first trick and the winner of each subsequent trick leads to the next. Any card may be led.
Playing second to a trick, you must choose one from a different suit. If you play a higher card than the one led then you play the third card, again of a different suit, and the leader plays a card of the fourth suit. But if your second card is equal to or lower than the first card, then the leader plays the third card and you the fourth.
The trick is won by the player whose two cards played to the trick count highest when totalled, taking numerals 2 to 10 at face value, Jack 11, Queen 12, King 13, Ace 14. If tied, then it is won by the player whose two cards produce the higher total when multiplied together. If still equal, then you will both have played equal cards. In this event the trick-winner is whoever was the first to play the highest-ranking card.

boardgame.name: For Glory: Champions Expansion
boardgame.description: The Champions expansion brings you back into the arenas of ancient Rome, this time with up to 4 players. New upgradeable champion cards, and other new mechanics add layers of depth while tons of new supply cards provide endless replayability. Play solo against the Ludus Magnus for a true test of mettle.

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0 (not for The Year of Moloch edition).

The box with the game closes without lifting the lid. The insert can fit 24 armies with segregated tokens and additional promotional tiles, monoliths, terrain tiles and two decks of cards.

boardgame.name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: The Little Beak Guesthouse
boardgame.description:
It’s the busy season at the Ugly Gryphon Inn! The bar is crowded, the inn is rapidly filling up, and you are going to have to take drastic measures – but opening up the adjacent guesthouse. The Little Beak, the quaint little guesthouse next to the Inn, is technically liveable and has been free of pyro-rats for several days now. Might as well open it up and collect a few extra coins!

When selecting a patron at the bar to go to to sleep, you may now add that patron to the Little Beak guesthouse instead of the inn.

When a patron is added to the guesthouse, the guesthouse is checked for irks from the top down. The regular inn is not checked.

To win, The Little Beak must have 3 patrons at the end of the game. However, there is a twist. The guesthouse can only have, at most, one of each quirk (noise, fight, smell) in the guesthouse.

listing.notes:
Base game not included
+ shipping
Paypal prefered

boardgame.name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Innployees
boardgame.description:
As you carry a tower of twenty filled pint glasses across a bar filled with fighting, smelly patrons you have an epiphany – you need to hire some help!

You may only hire one employee per round. If you hire an employee, flip over the top card from the deck. Then, check the quirk on the employee – it combines with the other patrons at the bar and trigger a bad effect.

After the employee is added – and any bad effects are resolved – when the player adds a patron to the inn they must resolve the employee’s special action as well. Their special actions are shown on the card. After the special action is resolved, the employee card is discarded.

By the end of the game, the player must have hired all three employees into their inn. For an employee to be considered ‘hired’ their special effect must have been resolved.

listing.notes:
Not included base game.
+ shipping
PayPal prefered

boardgame.name: Kulami: Marker Rings
Kulami: Markierungsringe
boardgame.description:
Now it's finally here: the marking tool for the two last played marbles, which many players requested. Two rings, adapted to the game in colour and size, show the two currently blocked plates and simplify the overview. In the new edition of Kulami the rings are already included in the game material.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fishing Lessons
boardgame.description:
It's been a year since Leland Williams passed on. A year later, his family remembers his humor, warmth and – especially – his love of fishing.

You play a member of his family going out on a solo fishing trip. With a specific sporting goal in mind, you'll recall lessons and memories from Leland. If you piece together the lessons in just the right order, you'll have a great day on the lake!


Fishing Lessons is a programmed movement fishing game with a sweet theme of an older man passing on his wisdom to his family.

boardgame.name: Mabula
boardgame.description:
In Mabula, each of the two players start with 12 marbles in their color on the perimeter of the playing area. Placement of the marbles is randomized as long as no color has more than two marbles in a row, even around a corner.

On a turn, a player chooses a marble on the perimeter of the board, then moves it as many spaces as they wish across the board. If other marbles lie in this line, push them ahead of this marble, with the only restriction being that you can't push a marble so far that other marbles are pushed into the perimeter of play. Keep taking turns until no player can go. Whoever has the largest orthogonally connected group of marbles wins.

Alternatively, you can decide before starting that a player's score will be the product of the sizes of all of their groups. In this situation, the maximum score is 81 (3x3x3x3).

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 2 Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 9+
MABULA - Kugeltaktik für 2 Auf einem schönen Holzspielbrett wird ein Murmelwettkampf ausgetragen. Das Ziel: Möglichst viele eigene Murmeln miteinander zu verbinden. Von den Startplätzen am Rand schieben die Spielenden ihre Glasmurmeln Zug um Zug ins Feld. Der Clou dabei: Neue Murmeln schieben die bereits im Feld liegenden vor sich her. So können verbundene Gruppen wieder getrennt und andere neu zusammengefügt werden.
Einmal im Feld, können sich Murmeln aus eigener Kraft nicht mehr weiterbewegen. Da kommt es auf jede Kugel an, die noch nicht gestartet ist. Timing ist alles im Gerangel um die besten Plätze. Die Regeln sind schnell gelernt, die kurzen Partien dennoch komplex und immer wieder überraschend. MABULA ist ein taktisches und ästhetisches Vergnügen.
Inhalt: 1 Holzspielbrett 24 Glasmurmeln Anleitung
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, ES, IT, RO

boardgame.name: Adsumudi
boardgame.description:
Your task is simple: Find a way to make Adsumudi's answer (the number in the center of each card) by using the other numbers on the card and any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. To make Adsumudi's answer, you can use any two numbers (that’s easy mode), three numbers (medium mode), four numbers (getting harder!), or for true math masters, you can use all five numbers (we call that monstrously hard mode).

Each card can be played at different levels simultaneously or gradually. Work together to solve each level as you go, from easy mode all the way up to monstrously hard. Or for a little family-friendly competition, let kids of different ages play at their own level within the same game.

When a card is revealed, everyone simultaneously tries to come up with the answer displayed in the middle of the card by adding, subtracting, multiplying, or dividing a combination of the five numbers displayed around the answer number. The first person to figure out a solution says, "Adsumudi!" They then share the solution they found. If it checks out they take the card.

The first player to collect five cards wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stworze: Odrodzenie – Pre-order promo cards
boardgame.description:
Two additional Event cards, which were added only for the copies ordered via pre-order campaign on the publisher's website:

1. Silent night:
- flavour: Stworza remain in their lair and don't bother people with their daily life
- effect: Every Stworze increases a countdown on their Lair card by 1

2. New mores:
- flavour: people stop caring about Stworza and forget them
- effect: Every Stworze loses 1 Influence token

boardgame.name: FUBAR: The Game of Quarters Will Never be the same!
boardgame.description:
Players create their own rules in a twist on the old drinking game of a similar name.

Quarters are bounced into a wooden box with holes cut in the bottom. In said holes are actions, such as smoking or drinking, earning or losing points, earning a pass to use the bathroom, or drawing a card.

On these cards are a variety of tasks and challenges hearkening to similar drinking and smoking games of the time, as well as cards that allow players to make their own rules, no matter what they may be.

The only real rules to the game set in stone are that the game is about earning points, noting that around 300 is a good number for a round. Beyond that it's up to players to bounce quarters into and around the box onto different spots and try to win!

boardgame.name: Pier 18
boardgame.description:
In Pier 18, you take on the role of a Victorian pier builder as you compete to create the country’s greatest seaside pier. Using only 18 cards, you’ll draft and position sections of pier, building your unique structure outwards to sea in an effort to score the most victory points.

During a player's turn they will draft one of the cards from the centre of the table and add this to their pier. This will make their pier larger but depending on how they place it can score them more or less points. The game ends when there are no cards left to draft and players tally up their in game (scoring the highest of that patron that round) and end gamepoints (a
total of all icons scored) to determine who is the winner.

Victory points are earned by meeting the needs of pier visitors and workers, as well as satisfying the demands of powerful patrons, who’ll lend their support to one pier at the end of every round. You also choose a personal goal that you’ll attempt to fulfill throughout the course of the game.

After a number of rounds the player with the most victory points wins the game, and is crowned greatest pier builder of their generation!

boardgame.name: Barow of the Bugbear
boardgame.description:
From the description:

“It’s bugbears that done stole my goats,” Enid says knowingly, thrusting the stem of her pipe in your direction as the porch creaks beneath the weight of her rocker. “Bugbears. ‘Ol Heck says its just wolves, but I know better. You’re a’spose to be adventuring types - you gonna do something about it, or not?”

The tracks lead away from the goat-pen and through the woods to a torch-lit cavern. Strange noises echo from within - whatever’s down there, it certainly isn’t a wolf…

Barrow of the Bugbear is a trifold pamphlet dungeon and the third of the Little Coffins series. Each Little Coffin is compatible with BRIGHTHAMMER (@hyvemind), Bastards. (@micaholism), The Vanilla Game (@infinite_mao), PINKHACK (@monkeyspawgames), and other OSR games.

boardgame.name: Order of the Hellspawn - Blood Hunter Order
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Summon chains to tear the souls of your enemies apart with this Blood Hunter order based on Hellraiser for DND 5E!

The Order of the Hellspawn uses the secrets of blood magic to explore the further regions of experience. To some, members of this order are demons. To others, they are angels. In any case, they obsess over their knowledge of pain and pleasure. Like the chain devils that created them, they dedicate their hellish blood powers to torturing their prey and making them suffer fates worse than death.

This product includes:

- A hellish subclass for Matthew Mercer's Blood Hunter class
- A Dark Gift to add to the list from Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft
- A new devil stat block to torment your players
- An expansion to the lore of the Nine Hells and Exandria, the world of Critical Role

boardgame.name: Pizza Taxi
boardgame.description:
Each player is the driver of a pizza delivery service and should be the first to deliver his three pizzas, in the order of the topping images, so the pizza with three toppings last. However, the other players can order new pizzas, put wine bottles in the way and thus hinder the other players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Howling Monkeys
boardgame.description:
The game is designed to encourage people to improve their own communication. Each player receives a game piece with which he wants to reach the target field. The player whose turn it is receives a communication task corresponding to the color field on which he is located. If you solve the task in the given time, you receive a chip, roll a color die and move your piece to the next corresponding color field. If the task is not solved, you have to stand still. There are also fields on which you can lose chips (red) or win chips (green). The game has 2 winners, the player who reaches the finish line first and the player who has collected the most chips.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Rickshaw Race
Riksja Race
boardgame.description:
Race in your rickshaw to be the first to pickup and drop-off passengers to gain the most points. But beware other players might steal your passengers.

Players take turns throwing dice to move their rickshaw on the game board, after picking up a passenger you take a card to see where the passenger needs to be dropped off.

The player earns points for every completed trip. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: This House is Not a Home
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are a House. You have been inhabited by numerous Tenants, but no one stays for long. Eventually, everyone who stays within you comes to recognize that there is something very, very wrong with you. There is a spirit within you, a sense of independent life that no house should possess. The lucky Tenants are the ones who realize what you are before it is too late.

This House is Not a Home is a solo game based on the Lost & Found SRD by Jack Harrison and loosely inspired by the novel The House Next Door by Anne Rivers Siddons. Created as part of the Lost & Found Jam.
boardgame.rpg: This House is Not a Home

boardgame.name: The Kaiser's High Seas Fleet: The Great War at Sea 1914-18
boardgame.description: Utilizing the basic system created by John Edwards for his "War at Sea". The game takes us back to World War I prior to the invention of Radar and no air power.

boardgame.name: Skippy
boardgame.description:
Card trick game, everyone tries to get no tricks or only a few tricks, whoever plays the lowest card gets the kangaroo and thus basically the next trick. The back of the card can help decide which card to play. Plastic kangaroo, partly outside the packaging!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Kreuzverhör
boardgame.description:
This deduction game contains 48 culprit cards with the following features: Place of residence, Current whereabouts, Facts of the crime, Special characteristics, Photo, Crime photo or mug shot.
In addition, there are score cards with an indication of whether the perpetrator is lying or telling the truth during questioning, which requires some rethinking when asking questions. In each case, the interrogators are provided with a total overview of all possible offenders. There are several variations of the game, in the simplest one a player receives a secret perpetrator card and answers yes or no to questions from the other players. For each no, a point card (14 to 1) is discarded and the interrogator changes. The sooner the perpetrator is identified, the more points are awarded to the interrogator. After that, a previous investigator is questioned about the perpetrator and in turn. Whoever has collected the most points after a complete round wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Gym Animo
boardgame.description:
Movement game involving stuffed animals and other tools. You turn over a card and perform the task described. If he has completed it, he draws a piece of wood, which he places on the tower. If the tower remains standing, you roll the dice and move the game piece forward accordingly; if it lands on the kangaroo, it jumps to the next one. The player who crosses the finish line on the game board wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Escape from the Haunted Hotel
boardgame.description:
The Hotel Terminus has been left without human contact for over 90 years until urban explorers, just like you, started to investigate the rumors of a haunting at the abandoned hotel. To your shock the stories appear to be true!

You and your team must move from room to room solving unique puzzles to work your way through the hotel before time is up and you are trapped forever.

Three games, each consisting of 5 rooms to escape from. With unique playthroughs, this can played more than once.

boardgame.name: Book of Beasts
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter Page:

The Book of Beasts is a bestiary you can play. It presents at least twenty-five new monsters in great detail, with further bonus monsters unlocked as stretch goals (see below). Each beast comes ready to play with tailored random encounters, presenting the Gamemaster with a handy set of mini-adventures to go.

The book also includes legends about each monster, introduces the option to harvest resources from slain beasts, and lets the player characters use their Lore skills to gain insight into a monster´s strengths and weaknesses. This will help them defeat – or at least survive an encounter with – the book´s monstrosities.

Unlocked Stretch Goal Monsters:
- Will-o'-the-Wisp
- Imp
- Golem
- Skolopendra
- Wolfshadow

Other Bonus Content Added:
- Traps
- Books, Ballads and Grimoires
- Artifact Generator
- Brews and Poisons
- New Magic Discipline: Magma Song

boardgame.name: The Bloodmarch
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter Page:

With this expansion, Forbidden Lands gets a whole lot weirder! The Bloodmarch is the name given to the volcanic region west of Ravenland, now accessible as the Shadowgate Pass is again opened. This ancient place of battle-ready horse riders and secretive dwarves is rapidly changing due to the demonic vegetation spreading across the land. Most see this red curse as a threat to all that is good, while others view it as a good thing – or at least a necessary evil needed to reach other goals.

The PCs can choose a side, or side with themselves, as the Legacy of Horn campaign sets the PCs on a hunt for Horn´s Astra, a legendary set of artifacts sought by many in the ashen land. These powerful items are said to be able to stop the demonic growth, or be powerful enough to ensure its triumph.

Similarly to the The Bitter Reach, The Bloodmarch expands the game world with a complete new area, directly west of Ravenland depicted in the core set. The map of The Bloodmarch, designed by Tobias Tranell, is divided into different terrain types, and uses an hexagonal grid to regulate movement. Just like in the core game, players can go anywhere they like on the map and explore the world the way they want. Due to the modular way the campaign is built using adventure sites, the GM can make sure the players don't miss the story without any need for leading them by the nose.

boardgame.name: Guadalcanal: The Battle for Henderson Field Aug-42 to Jan-43 – Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Deluxe Guadalcanal: The Battle for Henderson Field is a grand tactical game on the efforts of the U.S. Marine Corps and U.S. Army to capture and hold the island of Guadalcanal during the beginning of the island-hopping campaign to push back the Japanese empire.
Errors in strategy and logistics at large made this effort extremely difficult for the Marines, as they held on to the island in the face of Japanese on-slaught with dwindling supplies.
Players experience huge swings of fortune from one side to the other and back again as the battle for the island unfolds. Critical to the efforts of both sides is the capture and holding of Henderson Field, an air strip whose control dictates air supperiority and the ability to land supplies and much needed reinforcements.

The game includes a huge 17” by 55” map, provided in easily printed letter- and tabloid-sized sheets (8.5x11” and 11x17” respectively), that covers the northern extents of the island. Combat units are mostly battalions, with a smattering of regiments and companies, representing infantry, armor, and artillery. There are also specialized units such as engineers and LVTs that aid in the maintenance or destruction of Henderson Field as well as movement across the difficult jungle terrain.

The basis for Deluxe Guadalcanal is the original Guadalcanal game published by The Avalon Hill Game Company in 1966. The project began as an effort to create an updated version of the original game’s map, providing some tweaks here an there for accuracy or playability. Once completed, it was not that much of an effort to also create a new, colorful set of counters (including new informational markers) that simplifies play. It was then a short, additional step to rewrite the rules in a manner that incorporates some of the “advanced” rules, some new rules and mechanics, and known errata to create a new, cohesive rules set of under twelve pages.

Now, YOU can refight the battle for Guadalcanal!

– Description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
Trapped together inside a movie studio in the heart of Kyoto, you have 60 minutes to use lateral thinking to work your way out. Solve the sequence of riddles, clues and conundrums to crack codes and escape the room before time runs out. Use the included props to decorate your home and set the scene!

Also playable via video call or Zoom by mailing the components in advance, sharing clues on screen or adapting the usual game play.

boardgame.name: Quack Quack: No Take Backs
boardgame.description:
Quack Quack: No Take Backs is a game great for all ages. Have fun slapping ducks, avoiding swans on ponds, and mixing up cards with a turtle! Illustrated by Fowl Language Comics!

On their turn, each player flips over one card from their hand until an action card is drawn and, causing someone to take the pile of cards. That player starts the next round. The game ends when a player runs out of cards and that player wins.

boardgame.name: Tales of War
boardgame.description:
Tales of War is a competitive strategy board game for two players, which places you in the roles of army generals in the conflict for the Cross of Eternity, an ancient artefact holding the key to immortality!

The game board represents an open book filled with ever-changing terrain and mighty heroes leading their armies of medieval troops and fantasy creatures into battle. Each time you play the game, you write a new tale. It is your very own tale of war!

Key gameplay features:

- Skill-based combat. Players take turns activating one unit at a time and either move it to another position or attack an opponent´s unit. Tales of War doesn’t use dice, nor cards to resolve combat. Instead defeating enemy units is as simple as either moving your melee unit onto a square occupied by them or positioning your ranged units in the line of fire and range.

Each unit has different equipment, which defines its special rules. For example, units equipped with spears will automatically repel a direct cavalry charge and archers cannot make a frontal assault on units armed with shields. A player can still use the cavalry to outmanoeuvre a unit equipped with spears and devastate it with a flank or rear charge, just as archers may trap a shielded enemy by attacking at an angle.

There are 21 unit types and each has unique abilities, strengths and weaknesses. As the campaign progresses, your initially small force expands to include units, such as Elves, Dwarves, Fire and Ice Sorceresses, Giants, Hydras, Fire Elementals or even Vampires!

- RPG-like sense of progression and a constant arms race. Both armies evolve from one battle to the next, and your heroes learn new skills making them more dangerous on the battlefield;

- Replayability. Tales of War offers new, unique challenges and strategic/tactical possibilities each time you play. Each battle has its own victory conditions and is played on unique terrain. You will face a different, custom-built army each battle, just as your own army will have been re-equipped and re-organised.

- Ultra-fast setup and quick turns. Tales of War takes under 5 minutes to set up and tear down. Watching your opponents moves is as exciting as making your own as it always has an impact on the situation on the board;

- Ease of saving campaign progress. Simply put your units and their cards into your army box and that's it. You can pick up where you left off in the next session.

boardgame.name: Cardgame33
boardgame.description:
Card game33 it's great game for the family and friends. Also it's perfect for the party's, because if you lose, you have to dear to do. So you will never get bored with this game no matter with whom you are playing.

Cardgame33 uses cards number 0; 2-10; -2 to -9; 1/1/1 – add 1 or 11 points to the amount on discard pile; MINUS/PLUS 10 – subtract 10 points from the discard pile or add 10 points to the discard pile.

Players start with 3 cards in their hand. On each player's turn, a player has discards a card. When the player throws a card on the discard pile, he/she has to say the total amount and take one card from the remaining deck immediately. Game ends when on discard pile total number is high (33 is the maximum number allowed) and player whose is turn, doesn't have low, minus or card 0.

Player whose is turn doesn't have low, minus or card 0, to not go over of total number 33 on discard pile, loses the game. Players must always have 3 cards in their hand. If they forget to take a card, they lose. They game can end here or continue until all players but one have been eliminated.

boardgame.name: The Stifling Dark
boardgame.description:
The Stifling Dark is a one-vs-many hidden-movement horror board game with an innovative flashlight mechanic for 3-5 players. One player plays the adversary, whose goal is to prevent the other players (the investigators) from escaping through a variety of unique actions. As an investigator, your sole purpose is to survive.

Investigators move around the board in a point-to-point fashion using their base movement speed. They may sprint to move more quickly, but they need to keep an eye on their stamina so they don't become exhausted. Additionally, investigators can take other actions such as picking up and using items, locking and unlocking doors, and using their flashlights to try and find the adversary. Meanwhile, the adversary is secretly moving around the board trying to stop the investigators from escaping. There are a variety of investigators and adversaries to choose from, each with their own special abilities.

Will you fix up the car and drive out, or will you override the gate and try to sneak out? The investigators will need to decide if they want to stick together to watch each other's backs or split up to race towards the exit. Either way, they must move quickly - the longer the game takes the more chances the adversary has to stop them!

The game ends when either all of the investigators escape (meaning the investigators won) or the adversary achieves their win condition (which is different for each adversary).

boardgame.name: All-Terrain
boardgame.description:
All-Terrain is an off-roading board game where players explore trails and obstacles while racing through a continuous map.

In All-Terrain, players become the driver for one of the unique off-road vehicles. Drivers begin by outfitting their 'rig' with a set number of over-landing add-ons to try and gain the best situational advantage. As drivers leave the garage, they'll need to strategize by plotting their course through the known environment and around other drivers.

Out on the trails, drivers and their vehicle capabilities will be tested on hidden obstacles and unexpected events throughout the map. Once an obstacle has been revealed, other drivers can use that knowledge to their advantage when planning their own routes.

To win the race, you must be the first to run a full lap through the world and a final reverse lap. May the best driver win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blabel: Language Pack
boardgame.description: 36 new language cards that add flavor to the game, bringing different sounding languages and 288 new possible dictionaries.

boardgame.name: Pocketable Golf
boardgame.description:
Players select their own clubs and play against each other to attain the best scores over a 9 hole golf course that includes bunkers and ponds and players can hit their ball out of bounds or get a hole-in-one, just as actual golf play.

Players roll dice and convert their roll into yardage to place their ball down the fairway. The player who completes the game with the lowest score for the round wins.

boardgame.name: Aikido Game
boardgame.description:
A game based around animal caricatures of personalities you might find on the Aikido training mat, in every-day life. We meet the 'Strong', the 'Fitness Fanatic', the 'Sadist', and many others.

There are game variations on classic card games.

1) "Classical“ Quartet: players try to make pairs (e.g.cards 1A and 1B are a pair, 1C and 1D another), by asking one of the other players if they have the card they need.

2) Piranhas: similar to 1, but the Piranhas card does not have a 'partner'. the player stuck with the Piranhas card at the end has to do a fine (e.g. 10 push-ups)

3) Quartet variation ‘Trumps’: Here the categories come into play. one player choses for example 'Pain Tolerance' and then all players have to say the value of their card. The highest (or lowest) value wins over the others.

4) As 3 but with a dice: after the active player has announced the category, anyone can throw the dice (he/she has to pay 1 card to do this though). depending on the number he/she can e.g. change the category, take a card from somebody else, the value is doubled, etc.

5)The 'Randori' Cards (5 different ones). These cards can be used at the end of a game round (played as in 3): As soon as it is clear who has actually won this round, another player can put down a Randori card to challenge the round winner. The first player to lay a Randori card is the challenger for this round. Each round can also end without a Randori card being played. Challenges are e.g. reaction (who grabs the dice first on a sign of a third player), Mushin: try to lure the round winner from the state of 'empty mind': with grimaces, jokes, and sounds trying to make him/her laugh.

boardgame.name: Murder Mystery Party: A Slice of Murder
Murder Mystery Party: Kuchen für eine Leiche
boardgame.description: Painton Place is an 18th-century house, built by Sir John Painton, the first baronet, in Rutting-on-the-Rise, a beautiful if isolated corner of Norfolk, England. It's just the place to spend a couple of days on a cooking holiday - a Weekend Mini-Bake, as it's advertised. But the rural tranquility is shattered when celebrity chef Francis "Franny" Craddock is found dead, late Saturday night. Particularly when it turns out that he's been murdered. Suspicion falls on the guests, but who would have wanted to kill him? And what does this have to do with the legendary Painton Plunder, supposedly brought back from India by the eccentric fourth baronet, Sir Richard Painton? Everyone is a suspect when murder's on the menu. Here's everything you need to serve up mystery, murder, and fun - party planner, invitations, recipes - plus a tasty murder to solve. Just invite five to seven friends to join you for dress-up and to play the role of devious suspects. Serve up a meal or light snack, and you're ready for drop-dead fun!

boardgame.name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Candy Horde
boardgame.description:
Foul pollution blights the beautiful lands of Barbearia; Impossibly sticky and unnaturally sweet, this darkness corrupts anything it comes in contact with. The once lush landscapes are becoming tainted with an irresistibly delicious slime, and bears who fall to temptation are transformed into ravenous abominations.

The Unbearable Expansion adds two new features to Tales of Barbearia gameplay:

The Horde - Rampaging bears who have become mutated by the darkest magic in the known universe - candy! These mindless monstrosities have begun invading the realms of Barbearia, governed only by their insatiable cravings. Adds 15 Zombear cards.

Heroes - Powerful new allies you can recruit for battle. As grizzled veterans of war and adventures, these heroic bears are more powerful than your average barbearian. Adds 12 Hero cards.

This is a single player journaling game. Contains themes of death, surviving others, loss, and words unsaid.

This game was made for BigBadJam 2021. The theme was “games that transcend distance inspired by the folkloric item - 7 League Boots”

boardgame.name: Epic Chef
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Get ready to embark on a culinary journey as you take on the role of Zest; who must farm, craft and cook his way into legend!
Epic Chef is a story-driven adventure game flavoured with life-sim, cooking and crafting elements, blended together into one delicious dish!CREATE DELICIOUS DISHES!
Dynamic recipe creation means that you can experiment with thousands of different ingredient combinations to create a unique menu of delicious delights.

CHEF BATTLES!
Take on rival chefs in epic culinary clashes to be crowned cooking king! Dishes are scored on a variety of things and no two judges have the same taste – meaning every battle is different.

HOME ON THE RANGE!
Live off your land by growing food such as fruit and vegetables, as well as tending to an eclectic mix of animals from cows to unicorns! You’ll also need to repair and customise your dilapidated (and slightly haunted) mansion.

CRAFTY COOK!
A chef is only as good as their tools. Gather resources to craft specialised machinery that can process your ingredients, and even create new recipe components!

EXPLORE AMBROSIA!
You are free to explore all that the city has to offer. Visit various locations such as the tavern, the spa or try your hand at fishing. Meet the friendly locals and make them hate you less with the power of food.

TALE AS OLD AS THYME!
Enjoy a humourous story, with an elaborate cast of characters, all woven into a world inspired by the writing of Sir Terry Pratchett.

Source: The Publisher Website.

You've rebelled, flown the x-craft, swung the laser sword and stolen plans for moon-sized battle stations...

boardgame.name: Festival Tycoon
boardgame.description:

This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Manage your own music festival empire. Book bands, setup stages, organise your line-up, layout tents and toilets, roll out the food trucks and build your festival’s reputation to appease sponsors and earn big bucks. Create a festival empire, from humble beginnings in a tiny field you can build your cash flow as well as your reputation with attendees, bands and sponsors to make it to the big time. boardgame.name: Slingshot to Mars
boardgame.description:
Take part in a galactic adventure and mine valuable minerals on Mars and its moon Phobos. Slingshot to Mars is a combination of skill and tactical thinking.

Players launch their ship into orbit in a plastic circular track and spend action points to place a magnet to stop at a certain point. The track sits on top of the board in order to find the best mining spots and use your ship upgrades to gain advantages. The game ends when all the minerals have been collected, and the player with the highest total score wins.
